intro: Pterisanthes taeniata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pterisanthes, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant features opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. Its flowers are typically arranged in racemes and bloom during the warmer months. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
